job_title: Senior HR Consultant in Juneau, AK
pros: Wonderful culture, training opportunities, and some of the best health benefits in the State of Alaska.
cons: I have nothing bad to say about this organization.

job_title: Administrative Clinic Coordinator in Juneau, AK
pros: Reasonable salaries, great benefits, great leadership team, pleasant place to work.
cons: Once you've maxed out your pay increase steps for your position, it can take years before you will ever see a raise.

review_title: My worst hospital job in 16 years
cons: Management, bullying, getting cursed from surgeons and employees

review_title: You're not just an employee, you're family.
pros: Excellent pay, excellent benefits. Had I not needed to leave the state for a family emergency, I'd still be working there.
cons: Did not allow me to work remotely. They are a little behind the times when it comes to technology.

pros: Great management and pay. Good night shift and weekend differentials.
cons: Can be difficult to get your foot in the door.

pros: The goal of Bartlett Regional Hospital was to be the best community hospital in Alaska. They worked hard at it and I think they were achieving their goals. The last couple of years I was working their the CEO had changed a couple of times due to how the board hired the CEO so there was a bit of instability due to that. Yet I thoroughly enjoyed working with the entire staff at the hospital. It was like a family and they really took top interest in making sure the patient was taken well care of in all aspects of their care (physician care, nursing, social work, diagnostic, therapies, etc) for both inpatient and outpatient services. Maternity services were phenomenal as I was a patient there during my years of employment. My children also had a few visits to the Emergency services and I was very pleased with how they cared for my children.
cons: I think because of the hospital board changing how they hire the CEO and the movement of an interim and even a new CEO out of the hospital within a year and a half period, it created a little instability. The core staff of the hospital kept the flow of the hospital going. Hopefully, they have a stable CEO now.

job_title: Culture of Fear Doesn't Allow Me to Answer This Question : O( in Juneau, AK
pros: At the moment, I am struggling to find the pros of the work enviroment here after the recent change in leadership :o(
cons: The new CEO and CFO manage with fear! They both have threatened staff member's jobs and are forcing ALL the good people to resign. Sooner or later, the hospital will be ran by a group of dictators and I cannot see how well that will work out for quality patient care? This happened a while back and the Juneau Assembly had to intervene as I believe is the case now!

review_title: Overall a great experience with some frustrations
pros: Very accommodating and flexible, I have have been student for 2 years and they always worked around my schedule and were patient with me. They hired me on with no experience and trained me in a speciality area from the ground up. It is an excellent team to work with.
cons: Some of the administration decisions are questionable and if you get involved in the politics it will drive you crazy.
